reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's a cheap game, so it's hard to not recommend this game - but I'm not. The game has a loose story about arachnophobia and gynophobia, The game contains two short, boring shooting sequences and it's over, that's it. I was disappointed by the length (an hour at most). I dont know what else to say because there was nothing to it. I may be a little harsh, but play another horror game worth your time.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIndiephobia - The fear and disliking of terrible indie games.
voteText: 612 of 744 people (82%) found this review helpful 534 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gynophobia tries really hard to symbolize a deep, dark meaning, but unfortunately does a very poor job at explaining or hinting to it. There's little to no continuity in the little bit of story that peeks through, levels don't match and feel stitched together, and the game ends as abruptly as it starts. The time I have logged in is almost enough to beat the game twice (it crashed towards the end my first time).

Spoilers Inbound:
Without extrapolating more information than I need to, you play as a young man with an acute fear of spiders and women, living with his mother in a rather small apartment. The game starts with you staring out the window in your mother's room. Quickly growing tired of this, you decide to go play PC games, but on the way there you are ambushed" by a tarantula-sized spider walking across your hallway. After it passes
date: you are free to enter your room where you begin the first portion of the game
recommended: a crappy Left 4 Dead knock-off consisting of two short zombie-shootin' levels. After this is complete (no more than 10 minutes later)
hoursPlayed: the doorbell rings and you are terrified to learn that it is a young woman with a very low-cut top. Spooky! You make a dash to the kitchen to drink your stress medicine out of a very ornate silver bottle. This makes you tired
voteText: so you need to return to the bedroom and rest
helpfulPercent: starting the second (and final) portion of the game: a dungeon-crawling shooter that plays exactly like the first portion
votesHelpful: except now you have spiders to worry about in addition to the all-female zombie horde. Oh
votesTotal: and weird floaty head things. After a quick jog through two generic dungeon/cave levels and a simple boss battle
votesFunny: you awaken to find your courage restored. You charge out of the room
column16: and throw open the door to greet the young woman who had apparently been standing outside during your entire nap
column17:
and the game ends.

In Short:
Gynophobia lacks so much that I'm not sure I could even qualify it as a game. There's no variety
column20: and not much of a game to play. As I mentioned above
column21: I'm sure the developer had every intention to make this game as symbolic and deep as he could
column22: but failed to realize what his game was short on: everything."

reviewText:
I loved this game soo freaking much. This  is the story about the struggle of a guy that has the fear of women and how he overcomes his fears.
At the start of the game you wake up in your mothers room with her panties everywhere and head to your room to play a zombie game.The zombie survival is super entertaining and can be very hard.
After you finish the game you get drugged by your mother and fall asleep with a horrible nightmare filled with strange beings called women.You have to survive against zombies,spiders,women and yourself as you fight through hordes of enemies.
This game uses great visuals and soundtrack to emerse yourself in the cartoon artstyle horror game.
I highly recommend this game for people who want an amazing horror game in their library.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a game, functions fine, no compalinst there. Gameplay is pretty boring and takes place within two levels with some pretty average run-and-gun elements. Somethign tells me if the creator tried to make a more fun, more faster paced arcader style shooter they'd actually do pretty darn well with it. Game is pretty smooth in that area.

But the really unnecessary 'fear of the ladies/Mommy issues' the game seems to be built on is not only weak but borderline stupid. You're just scared of women, for no justified reason. You're dumped into the game world with only one line of text to explain what Gynophobia is and the only justification that you have it is that the screen gets all shakey when someone with an XX chromosome rings the doorbell.

You're also afraid of spiders; almost seems like an excuse to add an extra enemy into the game.

Bought it for curiosities sake, consider this cat to be killed. Buy if you want bragging rights towards ownership before this game triggers the wrong crowd and it's removed from Steam.
voteText: 181 of 234 people (77%) found this review helpful 28 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Hm, what's to say? Well... it's okay at best. I got this on sale for $2 and I can't say it's worth more than that. The game is all of 30 minutes long maybe, assuming you play the zombie mini-game. Basically, Gynophobia is about a young male of indeterminate age with a paralyzing phobia of spiders and females. His mother slips him some strange potion and he goes on a mental bender within a dream, fighting his fears to overcome them. That's basically Gynophobia in a nutshell. While I feel like there is an idea of a better story to be had here, the work simply hasn't been put into it.

To start, Gynophobia has some buggy walking detection. The difference between a street and a curb can cause your character to bounce up and down while sometimes loading in from a continue screen leaves your movement (and controls frozen). Additionally, you can surf atop of enemies! Land squarely on an enemy's head and you'll be taken for a ride wherever they go. Dead foes also present walking obstacles until they fade into the ground.

Concerning the art, outside of the last boss, it's generally very low. The female zombie-like enemies resemble something from a cruder version of the first Timesplitters with poorly stretched out textures and barely recognizable humanoid shapes. The spiders are somewhat better off, but I'm not certain as to why. According to the developer, these are stock assets. Understood, but they really don't make things look all that great.

This is the kind of title that's bad enough to be amusing and I suspect it capitalizes on that concept so people like Jim Quisition (who gets referenced in this game) will give it free advertising and cash in value. Gynophobia DOES have the potential to be an interesting game, but it's so short and cheaply done that all the tongue in cheek references can't make it genuinely good. I honestly wish someone more competent could have helmed this titled because the concept is there, but the execution is barely worth the penny. The game is so-so at best.

reviewText: As far as being your run-of-the-mill run and gun zombie shooter, the mechanics are competent enough. But the cheap graphics, uninspired environments, copy-pasted assets and little depth leave much to be desired. Particularly for a game that really seems to want us to believe there's some deeper meaning, some symbolic delivery of phobias and their psychological effect. Arachnaphobia: Oh look, a spider on the ground! The spider makes the screen shake. It prevents you from entering the room where the spider is standing. Because arachnaphobia!

reviewText:
Started out very rough when you start. You are greeted with very fast zombies, that you need to one shot to the head with your pistol, which is given very limited ammo (you need to find the rest). The speed of the monsters puts you on edge right away.  This can be good for it does have a high level of tension, sadly this tension turns into frustration along the way. The monsters only need to hit you a few times before you die from it, but the restart check point is the start of the level, and the levels get longer as you play. But should you strive on and make it through the game you will be meet only near the end against an ubber boss who will do you in nine out of ten times.

The game is not balanced, and while the graphics are not the worse thing in this game, the fact it does not respect your time is. It has fast pace action with guns that feel heavy, but the cost of dying is just too easy and great.

While it was interesting at the start it quickly got old fast. I was hopping it would turn around and be an so bad its good, but sadly it just stayed bad.
voteText: 27 of 30 people (90%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Game is divded in walking simulator sequences and FPS sequences. The whole game is very corridor like, and the premise of fear of women hinted at some kind of mysognistic wholesale slaughter of women for no purpose, which in this game`s case is not the case. So expect to be let down if you purchased for that purpose.

Pros :

Easy to pick up game with next to no learning curve and an intriguing premise
The engine does a decent enough job at rendering environments and characters

Cons :

The throbbing feature around spiders and women is not present in FPS scenes rendering one of the few original mechanics of the game absent outside of walking simulator sequences

No Replay Value! AND extremely short playthrough that feels almost as much a chore as a fun game.

Story is paper thin, competent enough to frame where you are and why you must do what you do but only in the most superficial manner

No dialogue or character development, no skills, no attributes, only 3 weapons, and hit detection on those weapon is underpar

Conclusion :
Unless you basically get this for next to nothing and dont mind the clutter in your library this is easy to pass up. Now that I beat it I will hide it from my library and never pick it up again. Still it was mindless entertainment while i was listening to the radio for about 45 minutes.

reviewText:
Intro - About This Indie horror, adventure game is one of my top ten most terrifying games that I have played. You start out as a boy that has Gynophobia (Abnormal fear of women) closely  related to the phobia of spiders...which you also have. You play video games which seems to be one of the reasons you may have these phobias, and your parents are concerned. Your mother ends up giving you a bottle of some kind liquid to try and help you. Last your way through nightmares to overcome your abnormal fear of women and spiders.

Pros & Cons ++  Pros
+Actually scarry
+Easy controls
+Not ALL jump scares
+Great art (Creature and character models)
+Price (Currently $3.99 US)
+Sound effects
+Low spec computers can handle this without any issues

-- Cons
-PS2 quality graphics
-Total of 3 weapons
-Not a lot of story or lure
-Game is very short

Personal Opinion In all honesty, this game terrified me. Spiders and I do not get along to well either anyways and this game has magnified by 1,000. The overall game play and the sheer entertainment of the game forgives the graphics. The price for the game is great for how long the game actually is. I do want to add that this game had a fantastic sound track and fit well with the game play.

Final recommendation: Based off of graphics, sound, control, story, price, game play flow, and overall user experience
I rate this 7/10. It feels high to me due to the low graphics its putting out, but the devs knew that and gave it a reasonable price so you are getting what you paid for, graphics wise.

If you found this review helpful and want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: Follow here!

reviewText:
Where do I start with this game. Its a short game for sure. But for the price I paid, I didnt expect much. I was infact surprised. Without going too much into the story, the gameplay ideas were intresting in the first few parts. The Idea of a young man being frozen with fear over spiders and women to the point of sheer uslessness was welcome. But after a while it felt a bit like a generic fps.

This is spoiler territory here folks.
The videogame in a videogame was an amazing idea when you realize its just part of him overcoming the fear of spiders/women/unknown that haunts him. And the fever dream after his mother drugs him where he fights with his fears was brilliant. I would have liked it to be longer. But all in all its an experience I can reccomend. This is one of those Im here for the narrative
date: not the gameplay" games.\n\nMuch love to the creator

reviewText:
****Edit: since this review the devloper(s) have taken their  time to correct the crouch key issue.  A big thank you to Creashock Studios to listening to their customers/admirers concerns!!****

I don't get why there are so many dislikes for this game.  I find Gynophobia to be an entertaining, unique, very smooth and responsive game.  Yes it does have its shortcomings in terms of some small clipping issues, the lack of a save system, and some odd and end issues here and there.  And as far as all the complaining about 'low poly textures' goes, I kinda like the rustic textures to be honest!  And if you pay attention, there was a great amount of detail put into the player held weapons and animations; but I digress.  Below is my pro/con list of this game.


Pros:
***The developer listens to his customers feedback.  The crouch key issue is now fixed, thank you!!

*Very smooth gameplay and interface overall

*Fun and responsive weapon system

*some unique zombie-surival style elements

*The enemies are varied and fun to battle

*The developers nailed it with the scare factor of spiders

*very nice textures overall (the 'poly count' on the enemies is a bit of a toss up in terms of it being a pro or a con)


Cons:
-No optional save system

-the game itself is a bit short

-some small clipping issues

-no sequel

Overal rating:

9/10

my personal reason for the rating (edited as of Aug 10th) (starting from a perfect 10 and deducting points from 10):

-1 the game should be longer

10 - 1 = 9 = 9/10 rating


****Big thank you to the developer(s) for listening to their customers****

***P.S. I believe Creashock Studios deserves some credit for the pride they take in their work.

reviewText:
I just finished the game and I have to say I liked it. I got stuck around columns in the final battle a couple of times, but not a big deal. What I really liked was the story. It did not dominate or drive the game, yet it was there. An anxious gamer, alone with his fears, a loving mother, an interested girl....

A great ending if you follow it all closely.

Bottom line: Games are supposed to be fun!  You have the highest graphics, or fastest blah blah but at the end of the day, if a game is no fun what's the point?

I plan to do another playthough, but as far as I'm concerned I got my money's worth! Gynophobia is a good old fashioned shooter, and a bargain at twice the price!

One guy just hoping that some people would buy his game. Sure it's kind of misogynistic that one of the few primary monsters in the game are women, but there was a real challenge to the game of conserving ammo and being careful at every step. It also goes to a time where checkpoints are far apart which gives you a real rush when you make it past the one" hard part. Overall I'd say give it a play. It's only an hour or long or so."

reviewText:
solid 7.5/10 for the 4 dollar price tag. I recieved it in a bundle. Based on that I would, of course, rate it a 10/10.

Pros
-Fun.
-Atmosphere was Very Good when you piece it all together.
-I do not want to sound 'umm arrogant/bad/steWped' but I never get scaced.. truly very rarely. There was no real shock factor but a 1.5/10 is solid for 'Me'.
-I often get bored with games and do not complete them but I enjoyed beating this one.

Middle
-Quick, solid, not drawn out playthrough. It can be beaten in about an hour by a speed run as in playing a twitch game 'pop n run'
-Running is Very fast, walking is almost too fast.


Bad
-Polygon count is very low but not to a HORRIBLE degree for me, I remember the release of Quake though.
-I counted about 5 gliches on my playthrough. Some were game-breakers but I did not have to start from the Beginning, just the last checkpoint.

I recommend it.

Quick Edit: The video and screenshots represent it well. Minimal Difference untill you add the glitches/pathing.

reviewText: Gynophobia has a unique concept and its quirkiness is something that can only be appreciated by fans of Eastern European game developers. If you enjoy games like Painkiller, You Are Empty, and Serious Sam, or if you're a fan of games that aren't afraid to do something 'niche', then you might enjoy this game.\n\nGynophobia is very short (my first playthrough took only 30 minutes) but I enjoyed every second of it.

reviewText:
This game had a lot of thumbs down but the title made it interresting enough for me to try it out.

The first minutes of gameplay gave me an eerie, spooky feeling and actually made me jumpscare. The difficulty of it impressed me and made me retry over and over until I finally got the hang of it. When I reached the first bossfight I actually felt the chills down my spine and enjoyed the horror.

This might not be Amnesia, but for a lowbudget-game I found it really enjoyable and can recommend it to anyone who isn't too demaning on the graphics. It is although the gameplay itself that is the most important thing, and let's face it. Who does'nt want a game about gynophobia :P

PS. it helps if you've downed a couple of beers before you play this.

Cheers and enjoy!

reviewText: Good and quick (emphasis on quick) horror shooter.  Interesting take on meta-games and dream play with good level variation.  Canvas the area for ammo and do your best to avoid the enemy hordes.  Some parts are a good challenge and if you mess up one part you may not be in good enough shape for the next.  Just enough explanation to guide your own interpretation of the overall story.

reviewText: To be honest I seem to have a different opinion with the game, i get that it is powered by unity and that it is basically a run and gun game, but when playing a game it is about the experience that you have whilst playing, not how the graphics are lower than the latest call of duty or something... When playing this game i found it fun to play, and rather emmersive with the environment. i admit that the story line is slightly lacking, but If you go in with the mindframe that the game is meant to be a jump scare based horor game, then the fun of these scares and the atmosphere made by the soundtrack (not the one in the trailer) makes up for the lacking story\n\nhttps://youtu.be/0rBtyXD2FdU

reviewText:
I loved this game soo much.  This game is about the struggle of a guy that has the fear of women and how he overcomes his fears.
At the start of the game you wake up in your mums room with her clothes everywhere and head to your room to play a zombie survival game. The zombie survival is entertaining and can be challenging.
After you finish the game you get drugged by your mother and fall asleep with a horrible nightmare filled with women. You have to survive against zombies, spiders, women and yourself as you fight to live another day.
This game uses great visuals and sound to emerse yourself in the cartoon artstyle horror game.
I highly recommend This game for people who want a short funny horror game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There's a lot of quality discussion here but a comparison to  200+ people production aint fit.
This is a nice short game made mostly by one developer. So price and playtime are adequate.

Most objects & characters are from the unity asset store. Therefore the style, quality and polycount varies.
After a generic start (zombies), the game's environments  develop quite some athmosphere.

The fps mechanic and physics work good. Map design reminds me of 90's good old days. Gameplay is quite hard but not unfair. And theres quite some details and fun ideas ( ie how to cross a bridge )

I enjoyed it and would buy again, thumbs up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game made me pathologically afraid of women and spiders. I had to quit my job and cannot leave the house because I'm afraid a woman will try to put spiders in my mouth. Also I sleep with a stocking over my head so spiders cannot lay eggs in my ears or crawl up my nose while I am asleep. I'm also scared of the stocking, but it seemed like the lesser of two evils.

In its present state the game is very short, so much so that when it ends you will be left asking Is that it??". The fact that I was left hoping for more is what makes me want to recommend this game
date: because obviously what I played was good enough that I hoped it would keep going.\n\nThe graphics are pretty basic
recommended: and the gameplay is fairly standard FPS stuff
hoursPlayed: but that's exactly what the game promised. It handles well
voteText: and the only time I died was because I panicked and didn't reload my weapon and bumped into a wall or something. Despite being in early access Gynophobia seems fairly stable; I didn't encounter any bugs while playing it (other than a bunch of spiders of course). It seems the dev opted for stability in early access rather than having a great volume of content
helpfulPercent:
which you can't really be upset about because the game works; it's just too short.

Hopefully the dev will add more levels and depth to the game such as elaborating on the backstory of the protagonist to further cement my newly found irrational fear of spiders and women.

5/10 - Just don't mention Spiderwoman."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWasn't that bad of a game, people now days are spoiled and expect something to be perfect. Reminded me of older games I used to play, really enjoyed it. It's shorter than triple A games but it doesn't cost $60. There's 5 levels including the boss, which is plenty for only $3.99. Sorry if it doesn't have the story you kids were looking for, but an old-school styled shoot-em-up is plenty enough story for me. You kill zombies and spiders with a side of zombie spiders (Disclaimer: No zombie spiders, I lied). Also, homophobic Dad's/Granddad's aren't exactly a groundbreaking concept. They come from another time. Learn to overcome your fear of being offended by stupid ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• as you come over your fear of spiders, ladies, and spider ladies 8/10 (9/10 for it's price).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you expect classical survival horror like Silent Hill or Resident Evil, you'll not find it here. Most of all Gynophobia gameplay  is near of kin to such projects as Cry of Fear and F.E.A.R. But Gynophobia doesn't use that much boring and cheap jump scares and the game length is shorter.

If you like scary horror games with guns and action, Gynophobia should be the right fit for you.

Full disclosure. I know the developer of that game.

reviewText:
The most painfully depressing depiction of the modern Russian mentality that I've ever seen. Step aside Pushkin, re-seat yourself, Chekhov, we have no need of you.

This game is stilted, homophobic, and sexist - you don't necessarily have to present gynophobia as sexism, and in fact it would be interesting to look at gynophobia as a product of a sexist society, but instead presents it as an almost rational fear. The only female that the protagonist is close to roofies him to try and cure his phobia. And then, once he defeats all the spiders and women and spider women and drider riders a woman is his reward. Hooray.

Also the zombie game is literally the worst nested narrative in the freaking world. Why do it? To demonstrate the mechanics before the actual meat of the 'game'? More like to pad time for this two-dollar experience. Everyone knows that nested narratives are a cheap tactic to make weak stories stronger.

Besides that, the game isn't... that great. The sounds aren't localized to enemy locations, the controls are... strange, to the point where I got beaten up by a twelve-foot-tall leather daddy while I was trying to get a tire to not clip through the car it was being put on, and the game artificially inflated its difficulty by throwing gobs of enemies at the player. But even then, it was still barely a two hour game.

In any case, I hate to constantly beat up on this game. If this was a first game, then, honestly, okay to you, studio, you tried and you made a product that is being sold and experienced. Now comes the even more valuable experience of sorting through criticism to make a much better game next time!
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Gynophobia is not all that well suited for a yes/no rating. I would never recommend it out of the blue to anyone but if someone would ask me about it then i would say that it is a simple fps that excel at nothing but it might be worth trying if you want to try something new, can find it dirt cheap and of course already have played the better fps games.

What i will say about the game is that it feels like a honest attempt to make a low budget fps. There is not a whole lot of content in the game but what is there works and the game feels finished.

So what you get is a cheap fps that functions but neither sounds, looks or feels all that good to play. I like shooters though and i can see a charm in low budget games that seems to have some love put in them. But my biggest problem with gynophobia is that it there is not a whole lot of content and the content is not very interesting or unique.

I completed the game in less than an hour and i can't see myself replaying any of it. The levels are quite boring and does not seem to use the theme in any interesting way. The enemies are with a few exceptions always zombies and spiders and even though there is some weak connection to the theme they are just not all that interesting not to mention fun to fight against since they do little more than run towards you.

It also does not help that you only have three weapons in the game. You get a knife, a handgun and a machinegun and this is just a plain boring weapon selection. Especially so since the combat section are set in dreams and games and therefore you could perhaps expect a little more creativity.

Overall the content feels pretty generic which is a shame since you could imagine the theme to be used to create something that felt more unique. So what you get is a pretty generic and short fps that works but would still have been below average in basically all aspects even 10 years ago. It is cheap though.

reviewText: Do not come into this game expecting a AAA or even a polished indie horror game. You will be disappointed. If you approach this game with the mindset that it was made by a newbie to game development who mostly just pieced together stock Unity Assets, you may enjoy it as I did. The premise is unique, and there were a few moments in the levels that I very much enjoyed. The game takes a little over an hour to beat. If it had been much longer, it would have overstayed its welcome.

reviewText:
Gynophobia: Solo FPS.
Who: Unspecified and unnamed male (you), women, spiders, ghosts.
What: You're shooting and slashing certain enemies in a pc game and in your sleep.
Where: Home, sewers, streets, dungeon, cave, etc...
Why: You're afraid of them so you want to conquer your fear.
Let Downs: Not a very lively game, not much story nor dialogue, overly dark and not that much color (a little dull, depressing and lifeless), short game.
Bonuses: Volume control, keyboard control, amazing music, amazing scenary, frightening, unique story, easy and fluid controls.
8/10.

reviewText:
Don't expect anything groundbreaking.

That said it's not bad, it feels really old school, with pick ups, FPS gameplay, a simple map with enemies coming to you while you navigate to look for objects to progress to the next map. (that point isn't good or bad, it just depends of you)

The graphics are okay, the style is good.

The game is short but good, full price might be a bit much for that, but I like this guy's work so I'll say yes even at full price.

I think the best I can sum this game up is saying it makes nothing new, like at all, but it does well its work of being a simple unsettling shooter.
